data.title: MLSsoccer.com
data.meta_description: Official rosters for each MLS club - including player stats, roster status and category
data.text:
Updated May 15, 2024

DAVE ROMNEY AT A GLANCE:

In 10th MLS season with 213 league appearances, and 195 starts, to his credit.

Became second Revolution player all-time to play every minute of a 34-game regular season in 2023.

Voted New Englandâs Defender of the Year by local media following his debut campaign with the club in 2023.

Starting center back for Nashville SC during the clubâs first three MLS seasons, starting 90 MLS games from 2020-22, including playoffs.

Set career highs with three goals and three assists across 31 games in 2022.

In 2015, became the first player to ascend from LA Galaxy II to sign an MLS contract with the first team.

California native played collegiately at University of San Francisco.

MLS CAREER: 10th-year defender owns 213 league appearances, including 195 starts, and eight goals and 14 assists across 17,852 minutesâ¦Notched an additional eight appearances, all starts, in the MLS Cup Playoffsâ¦In U.S. Open Cup play, logged 16 appearances, scoring two goalsâ¦Added 11 appearances in Concacaf Champions Cup play and seven appearances in Leagues Cup competitionâ¦Has made eight MLS appearances so far in 2024, starting six timesâ¦Appeared in all six Concacaf Champions Cup matches for New England in 2024, starting fiveâ¦The only MLS outfield player in 2023 to play every minute of all 34 matches in regular season play, and the second in club history to do soâ¦Also appeared in two Open Cup matches as a substitute, amassing 47 minutes with a game-winning goalâ¦Started all four of New Englandâs Leagues Cup 2023 contestsâ¦Made two appearances, both starts, in the Audi 2023 MLS Cup Playoffsâ¦In 2022, appeared in 31 games, starting 30 times, and set career highs with three goals and three assistsâ¦Started and played 90 minutes in lone MLS Cup Playoffs appearanceâ¦Added three appearances in 2022 U.S. Open Cup action and featured in one Leagues Cup matchâ¦ Set a career high with 33 appearances, all starts, and 2,970 minutes, notching two assistsâ¦Started and played every minute of all 23 matches during Nashvilleâs inaugural campaign in 2020, tallying a goal and an assistâ¦Added three appearances during the 2020 MLS Cup Playoffsâ¦Traded to Nashville SC on Nov. 12, 2019 in exchange for $275,000 in General Allocation Moneyâ¦Saw action in 12 matches, starting on 10 occasions, during the 2019 season and finished with one assistâ¦Added two appearances in the MLS Cup Playoffsâ¦Also made two appearances in the U.S. Open Cup and two appearances in the Leagues Cupâ¦Made 28 appearances, with 26 starts, registering one goal and three assists in 2018â¦Also made two appearances in the U.S. Open Cupâ¦Played in 29 games, starting 23 times, in 2017, tallying two goals and an assist over 2,249 minutesâ¦Made three additional appearances in the U.S. Open Cupâ¦Made 10 appearances in 2016, starting eight matches, and recording his first professional assistâ¦Played in four U.S. Open Cup games, netting one goalâ¦Notched five appearances during the 2015-16 Concacaf Champions League, starting all four Group Stage matchesâ¦Signed first MLS contract on Aug. 5, 2015, the first Galaxy II player to sign with the first teamâ¦Appeared in five MLS matches during his first season, starting twice.

2024: Has made eight MLS appearances so far in 2024, starting six timesâ¦Appeared in all six Concacaf Champions Cup matches for New England in 2024, starting fiveâ¦(3/17) vs. CIN: Made 50th consecutive appearance for the club across all competitionsâ¦

2023: Acquired from Nashville SC on January 5, 2023â¦The only outfield player in MLS to play every minute of all 34 matches in regular season play, and the second in club history to do soâ¦Also appeared in two Open Cup matches as a substitute, amassing 47 minutes with a game-winning goalâ¦Started all four of New Englandâs Leagues Cup 2023 contestsâ¦Made two appearances, both starts, in the Audi 2023 MLS Cup Playoffsâ¦(2/25) at CLT: Made Revolution debut, helping the club keep a clean sheet in a season-opening victoryâ¦(3/18) vs. NSH: Made his 175th career MLS appearanceâ¦(4/25) vs. HFD: Tallied game-winning goal off the bench in Open Cup actionâ¦(5/27) vs CHI: Notched first Revolution assistâ¦ (6/3) at NYCFC: Tallied a season-high two shots through 90 minutesâ¦(9/23) at CHI: Collected the 200th appearance of his MLS careerâ¦(9/30) vs. CLT: Scored first goal of the season, an 85th-minute game-winnerâ¦Earned MLS Team of the Matchday honorsâ¦Postseason: (10/28) at PHI: Made postseason debut for New England, playing 90 minutes.

2022 (with Nashville SC): Appeared in 31 games, starting 30 times, and set career highs with three goals and three assistsâ¦Started and played 90 minutes in lone MLS Cup Playoffs appearanceâ¦Added three appearances in 2022 U.S. Open Cup action and featured in one Leagues Cup matchâ¦(2/27) at SEA: Started and played 90 minutes in the season opener, helping keep a clean sheetâ¦(4/9) at SKC: Tallied first goal of the seasonâ¦(4/15) at SJ: Notched first assist of the seasonâ¦(5/8) vs. RSL: Marked his 150th MLS appearance with his second goal of the season, a game-winnerâ¦(6/30) at ORL: Played 120 minutes and converted a penalty in a U.S. Open Cup shootout lossâ¦(8/6) vs. TOR: Tallied second assist of the seasonâ¦(8/14) vs. MIN: Notched an assist for a second consecutive match, his third of the seasonâ¦(8/21) vs. FCD: Netted third goal of the seasonâ¦(8/27) at VAN: Started for the 150th time in his MLS career, playing 90 minutes in a shutout victoryâ¦(9/22) vs. AME: Started and played 45 minutes in the Leagues Cup Showcaseâ¦(10/9) at LAFC: Played 90 minutes and helped keep a clean sheet against the eventual MLS Cup championsâ¦Postseason: (10/15) at LA: Started and played 90 minutes.

2021 (with Nashville SC): Set a career high with 33 appearances, all starts, and 2,970 minutes, notching two assistsâ¦(4/17) vs. CIN: Started and played 90 minutes in season openerâ¦(6/19) at NY: Started for the 100th time in his MLS career, playing 90 minutesâ¦(8/1) at TOR: Tallied first assist of the season in a 1-1 drawâ¦(8/8) at MCF: Made his 125th MLS appearanceâ¦(8/15) vs. DC: Notched game-winning assist, his second helper of the campaignâ¦(10/30) at ORL: Started for the 125th time in his MLS careerâ¦Postseason: Did not see action due to injury.

2020 (with Nashville SC): Acquired by Nashville SC on Nov. 12, 2019 in exchange for $275,000 in General Allocation Moneyâ¦Started and played every minute of all 23 matches during Nashvilleâs inaugural campaign, tallying a goal and an assistâ¦Added three appearances during the 2020 MLS Cup Playoffsâ¦(2/29) vs. ATL: Made debut for Nashville in clubâs inaugural match, starting and playing 90 minutesâ¦(8/26) at ORL: Marked 75th career MLS start with first goal of the seasonâ¦(9/23) vs. DC: Notched a game-winning assist, his first of the seasonâ¦(10/11) at SKC: Registered his 100th career MLS appearance with a 90-minute outing...Postseason: (11/20) vs. MCF: Played 90 minutes in clubâs first-ever postseason matchâ¦(11/24) at TOR: Logged 120 minutes in an extra-time upsetâ¦(11/29) at CLB: Notched another 120-minute performance in defeat to eventual MLS Cup champions.

2019 (with LA Galaxy): Saw action in 12 matches, starting on 10 occasions, and finished with one assistâ¦Added two appearances in the MLS Cup Playoffsâ¦Also made two appearances in the U.S. Open Cup and two appearances in the Leagues Cupâ¦(6/22) at CIN: Logged 75th career appearance in MLS regular season playâ¦(7/23) vs. TIJ: Made debut in Leagues Cup play, scoring his first goal in continental competitionâ¦(9/15) vs. SKC: Recorded first assist of the season, his final helper for the club, in a 90-minute performanceâ¦Postseason: (10/20) at MIN: Made MLS Cup Playoffs debut, starting and playing 90 minutes in a road victoryâ¦(10/24) at LAFC: Started and played 90 minutes in Western Conference semifinals.

2018 (with LA Galaxy): Made 28 appearances, with 26 starts, registering one goal and three assistsâ¦Also made two appearances in the U.S. Open Cupâ¦(3/10) at NYC: Registered 13 minutes off the bench in season debutâ¦(4/28) vs. NY: Notched first assist of the season, playing 86 minutes at right backâ¦(5/20) at MTL: Made his 50th career appearance in MLS regular season playâ¦(7/4) vs. DC: Recorded second assist of the season in a 90-minute effortâ¦(7/14) at NE: Netted first goal of the season, an equalizer in second-half stoppage timeâ¦(7/29) vs. ORL: Tallied third assist of the season, playing all 90 minutesâ¦(8/14) vs. COL: Played 90 minutes in his 50th MLS start.

2017 (with LA Galaxy): Played in 29 games, starting 23 times, in 2017, tallying two goals and one assist over 2,249 minutesâ¦Made three additional appearances in the U.S. Open Cupâ¦(3/4) vs. FCD: Started and played 90 minutes in the season openerâ¦(3/18) at RSL: Tallied first MLS goal in a 90-minute effortâ¦(5/6) vs. CHI: Came off the bench as an injury substitution, playing 57 minutes and notching first assist of the campaignâ¦(6/17) vs. HOU: Logged his 25th career MLS appearance, playing all 90 minutesâ¦(6/24) vs. SKC: Scored second goal of the season in a 90-minute outingâ¦(9/2) vs. COL: Started for the 25th time in his MLS career.

2016 (with LA Galaxy): Made 10 appearances in 2016, starting eight matches, and recording his first professional assistâ¦Played in four U.S. Open Cup games, netting one goalâ¦(3/1) at CSL: Started and played 90 minutes in the second leg of the Concacaf Champions League quarterfinalsâ¦(4/16) at HOU: Played eight minutes off the bench in first MLS appearance of the seasonâ¦(6/14) vs. MAQ: Debuted in the Lamar Hunt U.S. Open Cup, scoring the winning goal in extra timeâ¦(7/9) at SEA: Notched first MLS assist, a game-winner, in a 90-minute effortâ¦Postseason: Did not see any action.

2015 (with LA Galaxy): Signed first MLS contract on Aug. 5, 2015, the first Galaxy II player to sign with the first teamâ¦Appeared in five MLS matches during his first season, starting twiceâ¦Notched five appearances during the 2015-16 Concacaf Champions League, starting all four Group Stage matchesâ¦(7/25) at HOU: Made MLS debut, starting and playing 90 minutes at center backâ¦(8/6) vs. CEN: Made Concacaf Champions League debut one day after signing a first-team contractâ¦Postseason: (10/28) at SEA: Made the bench for the first time in the MLS Cup Playoffs, going as an unused substitute.

CLUB CAREER OUTSIDE OF MLS: Appeared in 26 games for LA Galaxy II from 2015-19 under current Revolution Technical Director Curt Onalfoâ¦Saw action in two matches for Los Dos during the 2019 USL Championship seasonâ¦Made seven appearances for Galaxy II in 2016, scoring one goalâ¦Scored second career goal against Seattle Sounders FC 2 on May 23, 2016â¦Signed for LA Galaxy II as an undrafted free agent out of college in 2015â¦Made 17 appearances for Los Dos in his first season, notching a goal and two assistsâ¦Made professional debut on March 29, 2015, playing two minutes off the benchâ¦Tallied first professional assist, a game-winner, on May 29, 2015 against Colorado Springs Switchbacks FCâ¦Scored first professional goal, a game-winner, and added an assist on June 18, 2015 against Orange County Blues FCâ¦Also featured for San Francisco City of USL League Two in 2014.

INTERNATIONAL CAREER (United States): Earned first international call-up to the United States Under-23 team for a pair of friendlies against Brazil in November 2015 under coach Andreas Herzogâ¦Made debut on Nov. 15, 2015, against the Brazil U-23 side, starting and playing 90 minutes.

COLLEGE CAREER (University of San Francisco): Attended the University of San Francisco, where he earned multiple honors during his four-year standout career, including All-West Coast Conference Second Team (2014), West Coast Conference All-Academic Team (2014), West Coast Conference All-Academic Team Honorable Mention (2013), All-West Coast Conference Honorable Mention (2012, 2011) and 2011 West Coast Conference All-Freshman Teamâ¦Played in 72 games during his career scoring five goalsâ¦Started all 19 games during his senior season, scoring one goal and leading the Dons with six assists and 1,782 minutes playedâ¦Appeared in 16 matches as a junior in 2013, starting 14 times, and registering a goal and an assistâ¦In 2012 during sophomore season, started all 18 matches, tallying two goals and two assists in 1,681 minutesâ¦As a freshman in 2011, started in 18 of his 19 appearances, finishing second on the team with 1,689 minutes while notching a goal and two assists.
